Task.Name: Task
Task.Description: A single instance of an R4 Task FHIR resource.

authoredOn.Name: authoredOn
authoredOn.Description: The date and time when the task was created.

basedOn.Name: basedOn
basedOn.Description: Reference to a ServiceRequest resource that is fulfilled by this task. Each task can be “based on” only one ServiceRequest.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The FHIR codeable concept: hardcoded to a code for “community-resource” tasks.

Used as a Search parameter to differentiate between this and other tasks.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to an encounter resource. This matches the Encounter ID used from the Epic FHIR notification Web Service.

for.Name: for
for.Description: Beneficiary of the Task. Reference to a patient resource.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: The FHIR intent code: TaskIntent. Always “plan”.

lastModified.Name: lastModified
lastModified.Description: The date and time when the task was last modified.

multiple-statusReason.Name: extension
multiple-statusReason.Description:
Reasons for the current status. If Task.status = declined, then multiple-statusReason might contain multiple decline reasons. This field is an extension of Task. If there is only one decline reason, statusReason is used instead and multiple-statusReason remains blank.

Each such extension contains the following.

  • url (uri) defines the custom field type: http://open.epic.com/FHIR/StructureDefinition/extension/multiple-statusReason
  • valueCodeableConcept ( valueCodeableConcept ) contains the decline reason and has the same structure as statusReason

owner.Name: owner
owner.Description:
Requested owner. The reference to an Organization, where the referral request is going, for example the CBO. In the Organization resource, the following information is stored:
  • identifier (identifier): contains the external CBO ID that was given when the record was imported into the Epic system. There is always at least one CBO identifier.
  • name (string): CBO name

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description: The FHIR priority code: RequestPriority. Always “routine”.

requester.Name: requester
requester.Description: Reference to a practitioner resource. Returns only one requestor.

statusReason.Name: statusReason
statusReason.Description: Reason for the current status. If Task.status = declined, then statusReason might contain a decline reason. If there are multiple decline reasons, then the multiple-statusReason extension field is used instead and statusReason remains blank.
